course.subject: PAM
course.course_title: Sick Around the World? Comparing Health Care Systems Around the World

notes.note: Required Prerequisites: Introductory statistics (PAM 2100, 2101; AEM 2100; ECON 3190; ILRST 2100; MATH 1102; SOC 3010; STSCI 2100). Recommended Prerequisite: US Health Care System (PAM 2350).

notes.note: Only those students whose records show completion of these courses or enrollment status (junior, senior, graduate) will be allowed to enroll electronically. Intermediate Microeconomics (PAM 2000 or ECON 3103) and Multiple Regression/Econometrics (PAM 3100 or ECON 3200) or equivalents.
Enrollment limited to Sloan students only.
Prerequisite: AEM 2100, AEM 1200 and AEM 2210 or equivalent. Enrollment limited to: Sloan Health Administration Masters Students only.
